job_title: Outreach Worker in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Good benefits & team building
cons: The pay rate for the job

job_title: Case Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The clients are difficult but great to work with if you put in the time to get to know them.
cons: Management, hands down. Unsafe environment and they will have you handling medication on your own and without proper certification or licensing.

review_title: Toxic environment, unrealistic workload, lowest pay, no raises
job_title: Will Not Disclose in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Employee Medical Clinic, called Valley Fit Clinic
cons: Ridiculously low pay. Upper management and directors are clueless, toxic and terrible at following up on issues or training their staff. They overload their staff with unrealistic workloads and then penalize you for not being able to meet their unrealistic expectations. The new CEO is basically a ghost. He doesn't engage with the employees that provide him with his very comfortable $400K+ a year salary. He is cutting benefits and increasing the cost of benefits without allowing regular, performance based pay raises. Promotions are a joke. Expect a less than $1 pay raise if you get promoted but also expect ypur workload to double, even triple with hardly no recognition or adequate compensation. Instead, you get criticism and pressure. You will also stay at that measly pay rate and be told to be grateful for what you have, and that you are making the most you can ever make when you ask about an annual, cost of living raise. Management will micromanage you to the point of exhaustion and only care about their "image" and how good they look to ELT (Executive Leadership Team). They will throw you and anyone else below them under the bus when issues arise just to save their own skin. Please stay away from this place. I devoted almost a whole decade here and have nothing to show for it but anxiety and debt due to them refusing to pay livable wages. And if you express that you are struggling with anxiety and burn out they will use it against you when it's time for your annual review.

review_title: Wouldn’t recommend unless you’re just starting
job_title: Therapist in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The employees were cool to work with. The environment was okay.
cons: They barely paid a liveable wage compared to the bills and demands of being an adult with a masters degree. The requirements to get a bonus or a raise were nearly impossible. Not many people could meet these demands. My coworker worked there nine years and was always told that she couldn’t get anything better anywhere else. They refused to pay her. She walked out on the job and got an immediate raise. My other coworker changed roles managing more locations and they wouldn’t give her a raise. They don’t give you much incentive to work there. It’s a revolving door of dissatisfied employees that leaves the clients feeling abandoned.

review_title: Valley Behavioral Health is an Awesome place to work!
job_title: Operations Director in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: I have the opportunity to work with a very diverse client population and diverse Valley staff members. The current CEO Rebecca Brown is as knowledgeable about Mental Health services in Salt Lake County as anyone I have every met. She is passionate about Mental Health and providing the best services we can to this underserved population. Valley is the largest provider of Mental Health Services in Salt Lake County and have multiple disciplines that can satisfy the individual who is looking for change, growth and opportunity to expand their mental health disciplines.
cons: The private sector most likely pays a little bit more and if that's the only thing that is important to you then Valley may not be the best place for job seekers. Valley caters to high acuity patients as well as those with less severe mental disease and substance abuse. Valley can be challenging to some who are not well adapted to a fast paced environment and accomplishing a great deal with smaller resources.

job_title: Property Maintenance Technician in Murray, UT
pros: Convenient, educational, thorough and easy
cons: No negitave experience at all

job_title: Social Service Worker in Kearns, UT
pros:
Prescriptions sent to workplace
Maybe 5 ethical people and had clients that loved me
cons:
This is the single WORST COMPANY I HAVE EVER WORKED FOR BESIDES AMAZON!!! If I could give them 0 stars, I would! On the outside, they come off wonderful. Great benefits, competitive pay, fun, we care about your mental and emotional health la dee da. This company doesn't care about their employees, clients or visitors!! On the inside, employees and clients are mistreated and dismissed!! They say they care about being ethical, hearing your opinions about how they can improve as a company, but all they say when you leave feedback is thanks for sharing. How about ACTUALLY DOING SOMETHING ABOUT IT!!! Nothing ever changes for the better. If anything, they load more work on people's plates than they can manage in an 8 or 10 hour shift! 
They just volunteer people to do things instead of actually asking them! The way some employees treat clients is soooo disrespectful and petty!! I was there to help people in a respectful and relateable way! Upper management doesn't CARE AT ALL about anyone's physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, intellectual 👏 health at all!!!!!!! All they do is pull you into bs, boring meetings where most of the time is spent arguing with co-workers and other teams!!!! Nobody ever gets a consensus with anything and if you say anything to the higher teams that is constructive criticism, it is dismissed like it was never said!
There is a super stuffy hierarchy system where people are overpaid for being fake and giving reports. If you don't wear super nice looking clothes and fancy shoes, you don't get any acknowledgement from anyone higher up! No one should have to do that in order to be taken seriously and be treated with dignity!!! 
The clients are treated like second class people and have too much restriction on what they can do. I guess being someone who actually wants to help them out isn't ok with Valley!! No wonder a good majority of the clients complain about them!! I had some good managers and some good coworkers BUT THE REST MADE ME WANT TO VOMIT! They act like there is a solid foundation to their company, nope!! Stay far away from them if you want to avoid toxicity, you can cut with a knife! Back stabbers!

review_title: Great place to make a difference in the community

cons: Most employees become burnt out. High turnover. Never fully staffed. Pay does not compare to similar roles in Salt Lake County.

review_title: Please be very careful if considering working for this employer
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
You will get experience if you hassle
The overall atmosphere is great until another employer offers you a fair wage for your education, experience, and the amount of work you do.
cons:
I worked for this employer for over 2,5 years, raising hundreds of thousands of dollars as for the homeless, hungry, mentally ill and needy in Utah. I have been a part of helping thousands in my local community. I have worked countless overtime hours for non competitive pay for a great cause as well as donated thousands and thousands of dollars of my personal property for those in need.
As a result, when I left employment for an opportunity that is overall better for my family, the company left me, literally, with a final paycheck of $0 (including PTO payment), as they deducted literally every penny possible to pay themselves back for a tuition assistance program - with me asking for WEEKS to work out a payment plan of some sort. I have never signed anything consenting to them taking out literally all of my money from my last paycheck - yes, I read their policy. This has left me with absolutely no funds to pay for rent or food for the rest of this month and beginning of next month, with additional expenses coming by. I have communicated to them that the deduction will cause extreme hardship, yet got a generic “nothing we can do about it” response (and with the knowledge I have is absolutely not true). 
I have heard the feedback of many, many former and current staff (some who have worked here for decades and provided a lifetime of service to the company) that they have been treated coldly and very differently when they decided to leave. That is absolutely devastating to be thrown out like garbage after the years and time put in to make the company a better place. 

Valley claims to have a "strong person-centered focus" (direct from their website) when it comes to treating the mentally ill, homeless and drug-addicted. But clearly has no concern for the welfare of their employees.

review_title: A great company that has undergone many changes!
job_title: Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Supportive staff, work with a purpose, a leadership team who listens.
cons: Restrained by payer sources that hamper growth, and restrict competitive pay. Inconsistent management.

job_title: Therapist in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Develop skillsets and learn to work with difficult people
cons: Assembly-line therapy and having to work with difficult people

job_title: Primary Therapist in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Clients are great and staff is excellent.  PTO equals 18 days a year to start. This is a great place to learn but there is no reason to invest long term in the company as there have been no talk of any raise in the near or distant future.
cons: Valley has not provided raises for employees since 2008 and this includes a cost of living raise.  Medical benefits and retirement continue to be decreased.  There is little to no room for any advancement due to absorption of middle management positions and directors of programs being in charge of 5 to 6 programs to clearly save cost.  Little to no effort in maintaining offices and no paid time off for continuing education or conference attendance and Valley does not reimburse for any training. Pay is not competitive with any other agencies.

job_title: Case Manager in Kearns, UT
pros: Great stepping stone job to get another job in a similar field. If you’re just starting out, it’s a good way to build a resume. The clients are difficult, but I felt like I was really doing some good there. My co workers were also pretty good, but they all left for other jobs. There are also a lot of other opportunities within the company, so my advice would be to have no loyalty and move to whatever opportunity suits you. There’s a lot of attrition, so you’ll probably get promoted.
cons:
They talk about training, education benefits, having a good work-life balance, and a lot of other things that sound nice, but they won’t deliver. I worked at EPIC. We did good work, put in our hours, and tried to maintain some stability for our people. Valley wouldn’t follow its own policies and could never keep enough people on staff to keep things from going haywire. You end up with new people alone in a house of 20 people who are struggling against serious addictions and no one to call for backup. You start to feel bad about taking vacation days because you’re leaving your co workers high and dry, but you also know you need the time away if you’re going to stay healthy yourself. With all of that going on, it’s hard to stay hopeful.

In two years working there, I never figured out what Big Mike was in charge of. Also, management avoids coming onto the units because it’s easier to sit in their offices and write things. Or whatever it is they do that’s not interacting with the people they supposedly manage.

job_title: Multimedia Coordinator in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Doing good for the community, rewarding, room for advancement, transparent leadership, company actually trying to do some good in the world, 401k, great time off/PTO, really great paid holiday schedule, company culture is positive.
cons: Need to be a self-starter (not a con for me, might be for some)

job_title: Social Worker in Riverton, UT
pros: Easy to walk in, do my job and leave
cons: Felt pretty isolated and alone

job_title: Registered Nurse in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Stimulating work, good colleagues, excellent work schedule
cons: Little opportunity to advance in this company

job_title: Occupational Therapist in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Generally good people work here
cons: Chaos and confusion abound in management of this place.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Felt good to see clients progress
cons: Low pay and upper management was unwilling to increase

job_title: Social Worker-SSW in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Good job good people ok benefits
cons: Executive leadership don’t really care about staff.

job_title: Substance Abuse Case Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: None. None. None. None. None.
cons: They'll screw you over the first chance you get.

review_title: Very disorganized, minimal training, cannibalizing admin team.
job_title: Human Resources Specialist in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Clinicians and technical staff take their job seriously and try to impact the lives of clients in a positive way.
cons:
Despite the efforts of administrative staff (obvious by how the posts are written) to bolster company reviews by posting 5-star ratings, the truth is reflected in the other 90% of these Glassdoor reviews that describe how unorganized everything is, how hyper-focused on the bottom-line corporate leaders are, and how unfair, even illegal, they are in their treatment of employees. People have been promoted and then find out months later that their supervisor forgot to fill out the paperwork, so they never got their pay increase for that time, even when brought to the attention of senior leaders, because of an unwritten "no backpay" policy. 

Many in leadership positions have less training and experience in their field than their subordinates and consequently make mistakes that negatively affect patient care, and even place them in danger of litigation. A common thread in these reviews is that there is a serious issue with training and development, yet instead of leaning into that resource, that was a team that executive leadership decided to get rid of to reduce overhead. 

The admin environment is cutthroat and important positions, even entire teams, are laid off in order to "cut costs", instead of training them to be more effective in their capacities. Almost the entire HR team has turned over in one year.

job_title: Therapist in Park City, UT
pros: Good coworkers and loved that the location
cons: CEO was manipulate and not supportive

job_title: Medical Office Specialist in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The company communicated with each other through an app and you were always kept in the loop
cons: You worked with some questionable populations

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Greenville, SC
pros: The programs that VBH provide for their clients have great ideas and there's seems to be a decent success rate for people who complete the programs there. There are a lot of wonderful people who work as part time and full time non-supervisory roles for the organization as well.
cons: Many of the administrative supervisors were condescending, unorganized, and provided no support to certain employees. As case managers we received absolutely no training on how to do our actual job and the training that we did receive had nothing to do with our positions. The entire training process at VBH is essentially lectures on how "great" the organization is and all of the successes it has achieved. As a case manager, you have to learn all about your job duties from other case managers, who were often times misinformed themselves. The pay, $10.25/HR, is not comparable to the amount of work put in and the dangers of the job itself. There were no safety plans in place for the clients in residential services to protect both them or the employees working with them. Considering that the clients in these services suffer from severe mental illnesses and are perpetrators of violent crimes, safety plans should be an essential part of these programs. But they certainly are not.

review_title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner Truly Supported and Happy
job_title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in San Diego, CA
pros: I have been an Psychiatric NP now for 14 years and worked in different states and for different companies. I can fully admit it has been a stressful and challenging road trying to help the mentally ill. With my current employer, Valley Behavioral Health, from top management on down,I have never felt so supported in my passion and compassion for the patient.  The "How can I help you attitude" from my company is amazing. It makes me even want to work harder for the good of all; patient, colleagues, company and community.  Recently, I worked on a very difficult case that involved many community partners and this company stood up for the patient and went above and beyond to make sure treatment obstacles were removed. It was amazing. I was so proud. Okay, back to work! as I think I found my forever 'work home'!!!
cons: Not much really as the documentation and amount of paperwork we now have to do is not company related but rather comes down from the feds!

job_title: Case Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
I am proud to say that Valley is known for the ONLY dual diagnosis Women's treatment center in Utah. I am proud when I attend a court hearing with a client, or speak to someone within the County, they say "Ohhh you work for CORE how long is the wait list now, I have a few more women I want to get screened" Or "CORE is changing the way we do sentencing in the courtroom. We love seeing people getting help not just sending them back to jail or prison". It is a great feeling to know Judges know us and recognize our work. PROUD PROUD MOMENTS.
From the CEO to the bathroom attendant we all make a difference, we have a voice, and our highest up as made it clear our voice matters. Valley has been my dream job and to have so much support truly makes it that much easier. I can't wait to see what Valley has in store for the future.
cons: Case Management in general can be draining, but Case Management working with Mental Illness and Substance Abuse is extremely hard. You have to be prepared for this type of work. This has to be something you live for, not just a job placement.

job_title: Billing Specialist in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: I believe they are willing to make change but I question who these changes are helping. They have resources that are ahead of most metal health facilities in the state of Utah. They are business minded which is missing in most agencies in the state of Utah and that causes them to suffer but there still needs to be a balance of business and sacrificing money to help the worker or client.
cons: I believe these changes are for the benefit of the higher up positions in the company. The turn over rate is very high and I believe this is because the help and benefits increase the higher up in position you become. I have worked in companies where the boss is there for the managers, managers for the workers and workers for the clients. This makes it so that each feel validated and a focus of help from those that have the resources and abilities. I believe at VBH this is not the case. Workers have a hard time to focus on the clients because they are too worried about not making any waves with the higher ups.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: You’re given 2 personal wellness days.
cons: Overwhelming workload, high turnover rate, the pay doesn’t reflect everything you do or are expected do within a 40 hour work week, horrible communication, the only time you see or hear from management is when you do something wrong instead of when you do something good for Valley.  When you keep getting extra work added to your plate and can’t get it all done you get written up. Employees that should be written up aren’t but the good employees do. Health insurance is only Select Health and if you have the plan where you see their provider you get a huge discount but if you don’t switch to that plan the next has a $3000 deductible.

job_title: Family Care Worker in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: I had worked my previous job for 18 years serving people with disabilities but found myself needing to work drastically different hours, But wanted to stay in the field of human services. I am so grateful to have found Valley Behavioral Health!  What an amazing company, professional in every aspect. Equally impressive is the value  they place on integrity in and teamwork.  I am truly fortunate to be a part of this team and proud to support our clients in such a wide range.
cons: Taking such a drastic change in my career path I was bound to take a dock in pay although I am making less than I was at my previous job, VBH  does pay nearly a dollar more an hour then the same type of position at my previous company, so no complaints here. With such vast opportunity for advancement I am looking forward to a long time career with Valley Behavioral Health ❤❤❤

review_title: Be a part of the Solution!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: This company is fantastic.  You get to be a part of something much bigger than yourself for the greater good  of those around you.  I have not had that experience or opportunity in other vocations.  You can truly feel good about coming to work each day, and not only that the amazing culture and people you get to work with makes it even better.  It truly is a team.
cons: none to speak of at this time.  They are growing and adjusting  areas as they are needed.  It seems everyone is open to and willing to help.  I cant think of anything negative.  I love this place!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: VBH is the best company I have EVER worked for. I anticipate being with valley for many, many years to come! I am excited to go to work every day and be apart of such an amazing team and positive culture. I can honestly say that I have my dream job here at Valley! Our leadership team inspires me to grow professionally and be the best that I can be in my field. Working here is continually rewarding. Thanks to our awesome leadership team, especially our CEO and CFO for continually working hard for us and caring about their employee's by creating a beautiful place to work, an enjoyable work environment, great benefits and professional growth opportunity's. Our leader are making some amazing positive changes at VBH, we are headed in an awesome direction!
cons: I cannot think of any!

review_title: Front room and back room don't look the same
job_title: Case Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: If you are looking for a low expectation position ... then this is your place.  You can sit back and collect the check for a long time.
cons: If you care about client care ... then you are probably at the wrong place.  Especially if you work with the adult population with mental illness at one of their residential facilities.  Who asks the mentally ill how service is going ... no one.  But the drugs are good ... the ones the company provides them and the ones they bring in themselves.  They don't even claim to cure or rehab anymore ... their claim now is that they can save the tax payers money by limiting services.  Whether this is true of not ... probably needs to be investigated.

review_title: Couldn't ask to work for a better company!
job_title: Executive Assistant in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Valley has been the best company I have ever worked for. They truly care about their employees well being and want to hear what they have to say. I moved her from Michigan and everyone has welcomed me like their own family. I feel completely supported by my co-workers and supervisors alike. I can reach out for help or express my concerns (which are few to none) without fear of being reprimanded. I would highly recommend this company to anyone who wants to work for an incredible company who is working towards their future and building up their employees!
cons: There are very few cons (if any). The executive team becomes aware of any concerns or "issues" that come about and take them very seriously.

job_title: Office Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Personal satisfaction from helping a needy population.  Co-workers are top notch since they are certainly there for helping the clients and not for the pay!
cons: Very little room for advancement.  Low pay.  No raises for almost 8 years.  Poor insurance benefit (catastrophic insurance plans for employees).  Lost our retirement this year to be replaced with a 401K match, but no raises still.  People with longevity lost 5 paid days off this year.  Poor management.  (Some actually yell and swear at employees.)  Poor staff retention.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Holladay, UT
pros: Valley as a whole is one big family! We all care for each other whether we work directly with you or your at a unit miles away. Valley is working hard to break through the cookie cutter mold of healthcare service and create a new stepping stone that we hope will spread across Healthcare as a whole and change it for the better!
cons: Honestly, if you don't have a passion for Valley behavioral Health, don't want personal and career growth, and wouldn't like work for a company that is so involved you could message the CEO of the company and get a genuine response, than Valley isn't the place for you.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in West Valley City, UT
pros: Great clinical experience. You will definitely learn faster than most of your peers while working here. I received great clinical weekly supervision, and my supervisor was amazing! The staff at my clinic worked great as a team. My supervisor was always willing to give me learning experiences, and willing to let my creative clinical abilities thrive.
cons: The pay is low, but that didn't bother me too much, it wasn't too much lower than what my peers where making. Valley Corporate can be a little disconnected to the clinical world. It depends on what Unit you work on,  I prefer the West Valley Clinic.

review_title: Current employee- everyone is walking out right under the CEO's nose. In his office. He doesn't care
job_title: Aot in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Great co- workers and the v employees have a great desire to assist our clients
cons: The admin staff people are walking out. There were 3 last week. And 12 at our Tooele unit. Because we are understaffed. Admin has no clue what's going on right under their nose. And they don't care. Especially Mike V.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: I especially enjoyed feeling like I was giving back to my community. The companies work with especially vulnerable communities really drew me in.
cons: High staff turnover, lack of clear direction or stability in senior leadership, poor organizational structure. At no point did I feel like part of the team. Within 6 months I was the only person on my team still with the company, at which point I was played off. Lack of long term planning, don't hire for a position that won't exist in 6 months and then advertise and interview as though it is a career.

job_title: Rehabilitation Aide in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Valley is a caring, fun, and opportunity filled place to work. Specifically working at Pheasant Hollow has been an amazing journey so far. You have the ability to speak your mind freely and collaborate with staff to come up with easier and more efficient ways to do things. Everyone, staff and residents included are wonderful and caring people too. I highly recommend employment with Valley.
cons: Compared to other jobs that I have had the cons of Valley are minuscule. The hiring process was alittle bit more extensive than it needed to be.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: When I was there, Valley was going through a lot of change. It was chaotic. The way the were paid by the county changed and they were struggling to figure out how to manage it. Management was trying to change and adapt, which is a positive. There were a lot of really good people that worked there, especially in the programs interfacing directly with clients.
cons: The CEO was very controlling and tried to motivate people to work harder and harder out of fear. Corporate headquarters was a terrible place to work --  very toxic work environment. Lots of very long hours...you were watched all the time. I left when the work environment became unbearable.

job_title: Adult Care Worker in Sugar House, UT
pros: The pay is slightly higher than minimum wage.
cons:
In the area I worked, they asked us to lie about certain things.  The most dangerous ways they asked us to not follow protocol were in relation to patients' medicine.  If their pills fall on the floor, we were supposed to throw them away mainly because you might mistake some other pill on the floor for the right one but VMH asked us to ignore that rule. Also, if their weekly pill organizer opened and spilled, we were supposed to take them over to their pharmacy to have them sorted. VMH asked us to try to do it ourselves - us having little to no medical background.

Also, some employees would talk to each other about inappropriate topics such as sex.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Great pay, great benefits, great management in ValleyRx pharmacy. I have enjoyed working here and look forward to a career with the company. I like what Valley Behavior Health stands for and I enjoy working for a company that has values that align with my own. This long term care pharmacy will be celebrating two years in September and with it being so new, there is plenty of room for growth.
cons: It is very fast paced. I don't believe this job is for every technician out there. But it is enjoyable for me and the day goes by very fast.

job_title: Program Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: I have worked at VBH for several years. I have never experienced the support and appreciation anywhere else that I have here. My administration empowers me to lead my team and are always there to support me. My co-workers are incredible and the spirit of this company is truly magnificent!
cons: There are no cons to the company. People will always complain about documentation - this is state and federally regulated and is the same anywhere you go. Everyone has to document in any field they are in.

job_title: Case Worker in Tooele, UT
pros: This company is great!  I really enjoy my job and the opportunity to give back to my community.  They are so involved in the community and making it a stronger more stable place for everyone.  They really believe in what they do.  It doesn't feel like work when you enjoy it.
cons:
I wish we had more funding for the more rural areas of Utah.  
I also wish they would raise the pay rate for certain positions that are somewhat looked over.

job_title: Therapist in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Valley has a great communication system and values its employees. There are a lot of opportunities for building health and relationships at different events. Open communication is encouraged and promoted. There is a lot of support for growth and promotion.
cons: The healthcare is inexpensive, but a high deductible plan. Dental is a great inexpensive plan. The HSA employee contributions are matched, so that helps with paying out of pocket for some healthcare costs.

job_title: OFFICE SPECIALIST in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: I have only been here for a few months but I can truly say I love my job not only the people I work with but everyone at Valley, they are not only compassionate about their job and what we stand for but about the employees well beings. I have worked for many companies, and I LOVE my job it's taken a long time to say that, I am happy and my family see's how happy I am.
cons: I don't have any cons.

job_title: Program Manager Therapist in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: I feel empowered and that others trust me and the decisions I make. I love the fact I can inspire others and I can be a tool to help others to see the change that they need to have in their lives. I work with people that think like me and that accept me for who I am.
cons: I wish we had more ways of funding those in need of mental Heath services. That way people who suffering could get some relief.

review_title: Valley is definitely headed in an exciting direction!
job_title: Team Lead SUD Billing in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Valley has innovative benefits that many companies do not offer. We have a Valley Fit Clinic where employees and family members can receive top notch medical & wellness care at a drastically discounted flat rate. Whether the issue be chronic or urgent, this clinic handles it ALL. We have our own lab service and pharmacy, also! Medications can be delieved TO YOUR DESK and if you are being seen at the clinic for an urgent issue they have many medications (i.e. antibiotics, etc.) on site to give to you immediately.  We also have a full time Wellness Coach who is available for customized meal plans, exercise routines and classes. Valley encourages all employees to be well emotionally, physically and financially. The CEO and ELT are looking closely at competitive pay rates for all positions and are wrking hard to raise the bar for current and potential employees, daily. Valley offers a dollar-to-dollar match on 401 K and HSA accounts! And new training innovations and changes are being closely looked into, created and rolled out for the New Year. Valley is expanding into other neighboring states and financially is getting stronger, daily. Overall, Valley is a SOLID company to work for. The changes that are being made are exciting and we are always looking for compassionate, intelligent and innovative employees.  Also, there are SO many oportunities that open up for transfers and for advancement. You can learn, grown and move into other positions easily. The room for growth is definitely here! I have been working here since Feb. 2016 and it is most definitely where I want to stay.
cons: Many of the cons that have been expressed in the negative reviews are being addressed and have already been adressed. The CEO and ELT are working tirelessly in correcting and resolving any complaints. We are heading in a wonderful direction!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
Great team members
Growth and advancement opportunities
Great benefits package
Great organizational culture
Fun and exciting work day
Many job roles available means roles can change, while remaining with company
cons:
Some populations are challenging to work with
Organizational change culture can cause growing pains at times
Collaborative work environment is great, but can slow decision-making sometimes
Base salary for some positions is on the lower end

job_title: Office Personnel in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Every time a negative review is posted, two days later a fake positive one follows. The positive ones always recommend the CEO (he stinks! The size of the company is obviously beyond his ability to handle. Might be why it's steadily shrinking and the employee retention rates are non-existant.)  The only pros are your fellow employees (but they're constantly leaving.. Let's be honest: even Walmart pays better) and the feeling you get after helping someone in desperate need.
cons: Clueless CEO, unsympathetic and unappreciative management, NO PAY RAISES FOR SIX YEARS. This cannot be mentioned enough.

job_title: Autism Assistant in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The Carmen B. Pingree Center was a wonderful team environment, and the staff are extremely caring and loving toward the children.  This was the job that made me know that I wanted to work with children with autism as a career.
cons: The Autism Assistants are vastly underpaid.  Because of this, I feel many of the best staff who want to expand their careers end up leaving for better opportunities.

job_title: Case Manager in Tampa, FL
pros: Provided an opportunity to have a career in social services. Allowed employees to choose desired shift.
cons: Lack of training for case managers in the EPIC program, with most employees overworked and doing the best they can to wing it. Inequitable treatment of clients in the various units with regards to rule enforcement, which causes contention. Management unable to understand the stresses of the job and unwilling to ease the pressure. Management willing, however, to fire an employee days before Christmas for not receiving proper training on Medicaid billing.

review_title: No raises, you are on your own!
job_title: Residential Counselor in Columbus, OH
pros: Floor staff usually have your back, it was a good environment. Room for growth & learning opportunities. It was a flexible job because you made friends with the floor staff and they would help cover your shifts if you had a family thing.
cons: Management doesn't care about you. I received 1 raise in ten years and I had to demand it. I found out new employees were starting at MORE then what I made. Upper Management has a horrible way of handling things and is very unethical.

job_title: in Kearns, UT
pros:
I love my job I haven gotten a lot of good feed back from everyone I started out part time and the job turned into full time I have cleaned the main building, children's unit and the food bank and resource center, they notice when I have gone above and beyond my duties which makes me appreciated
  ,
cons: there is no bad sides to the job they are very flexible and easy to work with and enjoy working there

job_title: Line Staff in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The staff there that do care about the clients.
cons: Where do I begin...Bigwigs want to have new a new admin building, yet the inpatient units are falling apart. No raises in sight. Little pay for people with college degrees. Not enough to pay back student loans.

job_title: Case Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: That they are digging their own grave, and all professional service providers know this, the county knows it, and they know it... tick, tick, tick...
cons:
This employer appears to commit employment theft against their employees- asking employees to subsidize services for clients out of their own pocket i.e., renting DVD for clients to watch for classes, paying for poorly planned outings, not providing ability to navigate parking meters in the downtown area when clients need services at courts, SS, DWS, etc. Employer expects employee to pay for parking, to use their own credit cards at the meter and with all of this they say "we don't refund" So basically they are stealing from employees. 

Valley admin has stated in employee meeting that the CEO and others at that level hate hearing people ask for raises and that when they are asked, they say "their heads explode with anger" The pay is LOW, and most employees are on PRN rolls, or are not allowed to work more than 32 hours a week at less than 12 and hour. They do not recognize diplomas, education, or experience - at a detriment to their clients. They frequently refer to clients as "entitled" "borderlines" and/or "schizophrenics" it was upsetting as persons with mental health concerns are not their diagnosis and first person language needs to return as a fundamental level of human right in the human service field that they portend to offer. 

VMH has HORRID health plans - they are really not health plans. For physical health the deductible is $1,500 to $3,000 a year and RX are not covered. They offer an HSA then fail to deposit monies into the accounts, monies that you ask to be put into accts and "gifts" of deposit that they offer and promise to employees. As well, they do not appear to pay out on their wellness plans - If you fax any paperwork to admin "it gets lost" it seems that since there is only two people in the payroll and benefit department that they may just throw away papers to avoid being drowned by working with over 900 employees. As well, the average employee only makes about eleven dollars and fourteen cents an hour and up to fourteen dollars. If you are a contract worker or a therapist, you make more but still the pay is minimal and the work expectations are such that it is once again theft due to potential reporting of time 

There is a review on here about discord among employees and other things and they are correct - however I was never encouraged or advised to use meds that dropped on the floor and if I was I would never support that. Mostly my concern is that if an agency is not taking care of it's own, then they are not taking care of their clients.... 

The county should have shut them down when the community, and stakeholders approached the county and requested that they do just that... 

Again, tick, tick, tick.... tock!!!!

job_title: Maintenance Supervisor in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: I look forward to going to work everyday. The positivity I've experienced from the staff I've worked with and been in contact with is excellent. I have a great job working for great people doing what I love and do best.
cons: I have no complaints about this employer. I have the best supervisor and work with an awesome team, who support me and will do whatever to help me succeed.

job_title: Case Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
PTO was good,
some really dedicated and passionate co-workers
cons:
Not able to take PTO due to constant understaffing
Lack of communication from supervisors
no support from supervisors after reaching out several times and asking for help. I let them know I was having some medical issues and was reprimanded for it. 
I let them know I was having some issues with just a few of the clients and got no support, undermined by other staff when trying to set boundaries making everything even more difficult. I asked for several different options that could help me out and was denied all of them.

job_title: Senior Staff Trainer in Highland, UT
pros: Valley has been around for a very long time and is changing and updating as needed to be able to continue to  provide quality service. It truly is a great company to work for.
cons: My experience with the company has been a wonderful journey. Valley has been very good to me so I have nothing to say that is a con.

job_title: Therapist in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Good clients who are struggling and need your help.
cons: They advertise that they give bonuses to therapists but that is not true because many of the clients no show, so even if you work really hard to get it, you won't. Management is terrible and doesn't care about you at all. period.  Left on a terrible note and the manager wouldn't even say goodbye to me. Very petty.

job_title: Case Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
- Client Care
- Changing lives.
- Teaching
- Temporary personal growth.
cons:
- Unfair treatment.
- Unclear Direction
- Toxic Environment
- Poor treatment of clients.
- Stay away from this company.

I truly can't express enough to people interested in Valley Behavioral Health Epic Campus to stay away from this incredibly toxic and horrific environment. Find somewhere else. It truly is not worth the mental stress and toll it will have on you if you work here. You are not trained thoroughly and accurately, none of the policies that are in place are consistent, you won't truly know what is wrong and what is okay, if you're an addict in recovery and work here you won't be treated fairly even when you are qualified to take on a higher position. I say this because if your like me and truly care about the type of work you do in this field, it will go unnoticed and not matter at the end of the day to upper management. Stay away.

job_title: Case Manager in Saint George, UT
pros: 880 hours closer clinical experience. Looking for an entry level position in community oriented facility. Excellent customer service skills, computer skills are outstanding
cons: New environment, 50 mile commute each way, will be new in the field with a paid position. Have been working part time as a cashier.

review_title: Really appreciate all the good changes
job_title: Business Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Not afraid to make changes that need to be made, salary raises top of the list for 2018 and the benefits we were offered for next year are better than most.  Advancement is within reach.  Clinical staff is getting more attention.
cons: Nonprofit means we are unable to make huge changes.  Some of the programs really need revision.

review_title: New Management is running company in the ground
job_title: Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Does incredible work with clients that are very vulnerable and need advocates.  Homeless services are top notch.
cons: New management is not open to listening, their way or the highway. Clients are having to change therapist which is difficult for many and many are being pushed out to get their therapy elsewhere.  Upper management is non communicative or responsive to concerns, even if concerns are around Medicaid mismanagement and fraud.

review_title: Great company to be an employee
job_title: Case Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Diversity! There are so many different things you can do with this company! It seems that any part of mental health you can think of, Valley has something that fits! There are a ton of opportunities that arise from the training they provide!
cons: My job is considered part time even though I work almost 40 hours a week and have overtime occasionally.

job_title: in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The great thing about Valley is the team and helping environment. Everyone works together to make sure clients are cared for. I love that if you need help you are comfortable enough to ask others that may not be on your team but they are willing to help.
cons: I cannot think of one thing that I would change

job_title: Client Care in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Not many I can think of
cons:
Management does not care about you, they claim to, but when serious issues are brought up, they look the other way.
Very low pay
Treat you badly, and in some departments, managers will "gang up" on an employee and make life miserable

job_title: Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: There are not any pros to working here. It hurt my career and now I have to start over. People always wonder why I took a job here. They warned me and I didn't listen.
cons: No company values, no value of employees, and honestly I wonder if they value humans. They are providing a very needed service and they don't do it well.

job_title: Case Manager in Park City, UT
pros: Broad range of clients which provides a strong learning experience. Director of the Summit County clinic is supportive and values their team.
cons: I found company leadership to be punishing rather than supportive. There was a total lack of sufficient training. However, my director at the Summit Outpatient location was excellent.

job_title: IT Support Technician in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Great benefits, opportunity for advancement, competitive wages, management that cares and listens. Most important - the work Valley Behavioral Health does to  improve the lives of the individuals they serve and their families.
cons: Presently, I don't have any cons.

job_title: Therapist in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: This organization cares about the clients, the employees and the community. Valley has worked very hard to build relationships with community partners in Tooele.
cons: If you do not believe in providing the best care and customer service, this organization is not for you.

job_title: Case Manager in Park City, UT
pros: Great team in Summit County. Great community. A lot of support from the community.
cons: The administration is making too many unrealistic changes at once. The administration does not have a good understanding of how all of their many units work.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Murray, UT
pros:
Valley is so passionate about changing for the better internally so that we can service our clients more effectively, with a first class customer service and with best therapies and facilities possible.
Way to go Valley!
cons: I have always been treated well

review_title: So Happy with the new/improved Valley!
job_title: Care Coordinator- Utilization Management in Tooele, UT
pros: Inovative leadership. Forward thinking. Compassionate and supportive of employees. Flexible, family-oriented schedules. ValleyFit Clinic! Excellent Communication with all employees, regularly!
cons: No sick leave. Compensation still low in some areas, but improving.

job_title: Operations Director in Tooele, UT
pros: I love working for this company. Their focus is truly on providing a good service to their clients.
cons: The only thing that could possibly be a "con" is that we are always very busy.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: If you are an intern Valley is a decent place to start.
cons: Being a fully licensed therapist for Valley is not ideal. You have to beg to get trainined and the salary is extremely low.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: flexible schedules, nice co workers
cons: performance is not rewarded with pay increase. Most employees have gone without a pay increase for over five years. Turnover is 100%

job_title: in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The employees truly care about making a difference in the lives of our clients, their families and the community.  We have a GREAT team!
cons: I really don't have any

job_title: OFFICE SPECIALIST in Holladay, UT
pros: The culture at Valley Behavioral Health is mutual success. Everyone around you is trying to help you succeed!
cons: All of the insurance plan options have pretty high deductibles.

review_title: Overall, excellent company to work for!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Great company culture, high expectations, lots of learning opportunities, opportunity to grow, work life balance
cons: It would be great to have better benefits.

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: There is a State pension plan and 401 K match.
cons: A nonprofit organizaiton in the social service industry.

job_title: Attending Clinician in Tooele, UT
pros: Team oriented work, supportive leadership, learning and growth opportunities.
cons: Benefits. The medical benefits are nice to have, but they aren't the best.

job_title: Office Assistant in Salt Lake City, UT

job_title: CSW in South Salt Lake, UT

job_title: Team Lead in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: My career is fulfilling.

job_title: Shift Lead in Kearns, UT

job_title: Team Leader in Salt Lake City, UT

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
